body:
In spack's packages, several protocols (ftp, http, https) are used to download tar from GNU site ftp.gnu.org. These protocols function equivelantly. However, compared to ftp, http/https are easier to set up behind a firewall via a transparent proxy, namely squid.

How about substituting all `ftp://ftp.gnu.org` with `https://ftp.gnu.org`?
title: Downloading protocols are inconsistent for the GNU site
